de.mslab.matching

Class MatchingContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mslab.matching.MatchingContext

  • public class MatchingContext
extends java.lang.Object
    Context, which bundles the parameters for the MatchingDifferentialBuilder.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Biclique biclique
      The target biclique, for which the matching phase shall be analyzed.
      RoundBasedBlockCipher cipher
      The target cipher, to compute differential trails for the matching phase.
      RecomputedOperationsCounter counter
      Counts the number of active components in non-linear operations during the matching.
      boolean isMatchingFixed
      By default, the MatchingDifferentialBuilder iterates over all values for matching rounds and bytes in the cipher state for partial matching in order to find a matching with minimal number of active components in non-linear operation.
      int matchingFromRound
      By default, the matching interval covers the rounds from start of the cipher to the first round of the biclique (if the biclique is located at the end), or the rounds from after the last round of the biclique to the end of the cipher.
      int matchingRound
      Used if the isMatchingFixed is set to true.
      ByteArray matchingStateDifference
      Used if the isMatchingFixed is set to true.
      int matchingToRound
      By default, the matching interval covers the rounds from start of the cipher to the first round of the biclique (if the biclique is located at the end), or the rounds from after the last round of the biclique to the end of the cipher.
      int numIterations
      The class MatchingDifferentialBuilder can create the differentials in the matching phases in multiple iterations with randomized key differences each.
      int numMatchingBits
      Set this value to influence the number of bytes, which are used at the matching state for a partial matching.

    • Field Detail

      • biclique

        public Biclique biclique
        The target biclique, for which the matching phase shall be analyzed. For the matching, the rounds of the bicliques and the keys are important.

      • cipher

        public RoundBasedBlockCipher cipher
        The target cipher, to compute differential trails for the matching phase.

      • counter

        public RecomputedOperationsCounter counter
        Counts the number of active components in non-linear operations during the matching.

      • matchingRound

        public int matchingRound
        Used if the isMatchingFixed is set to true.

      • matchingStateDifference

        public ByteArray matchingStateDifference
        Used if the isMatchingFixed is set to true.

      • isMatchingFixed

        public boolean isMatchingFixed
        By default, the MatchingDifferentialBuilder iterates over all values for matching rounds and bytes in the cipher state for partial matching in order to find a matching with minimal number of active components in non-linear operation. You can set this flag to true, and set the values matchingRound and activeMatchingByte. Then, the MatchingDifferentialBuilder will not iterate over rounds and bytes to decrease the computational effort.

      • matchingFromRound

        public int matchingFromRound
        By default, the matching interval covers the rounds from start of the cipher to the first round of the biclique (if the biclique is located at the end), or the rounds from after the last round of the biclique to the end of the cipher. For ciphers where the matching over the full number of rounds would be inefficient, you can change the start of the matching by setting this parameter to mount a matching for a round reduced version of the cipher.

      • matchingToRound

        public int matchingToRound
        By default, the matching interval covers the rounds from start of the cipher to the first round of the biclique (if the biclique is located at the end), or the rounds from after the last round of the biclique to the end of the cipher. For ciphers where the matching over the full number of rounds would be inefficient, you can change the end of the matching by setting this parameter to mount a matching for a round reduced version of the cipher.

      • numIterations

        public int numIterations
        The class MatchingDifferentialBuilder can create the differentials in the matching phases in multiple iterations with randomized key differences each.

      • numMatchingBits

        public int numMatchingBits
        Set this value to influence the number of bytes, which are used at the matching state for a partial matching. The more bytes are used, the more components may need to be recomputed. Thus, the more bytes are used, the higher the computational complexity.
